title: Chanting Cintāmaṇi Prayers
image_desc: - A photo of Srila Prabhupada chanting.
narration: In this video, we will hear Srila Prabhupada chant the Cintāmaṇi prayers from the Brahma-saṁhitā.

title: Cintāmaṇi Prayers
content: - These prayers describe the transcendental abode of Kṛṣṇaloka.
- They are filled with beautiful imagery and devotional sentiment.
image_desc: - A photo of a beautiful, colorful, and ornate temple.
narration: The Cintāmaṇi prayers describe the transcendental abode of Kṛṣṇaloka, the spiritual world. They are filled with beautiful imagery and devotional sentiment.

title: The First Verse
image_desc: - A photo of a cow grazing in a lush green field.
narration: The first verse describes Kṛṣṇa tending the cows in abodes built with spiritual gems, surrounded by millions of wish-fulfilling trees, and served by hundreds of thousands of gopīs.

title: Verse Two
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna playing the flute.
narration: The second verse describes Kṛṣṇa playing His flute, with blooming eyes like lotus petals, a peacock feather on His head, and a beautiful blue complexion.

title: Verse Three
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The third verse describes Kṛṣṇa's beautiful form, adorned with a garland of flowers, a flute, and jeweled ornaments.

title: Verse Four
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The fourth verse repeats the first verse, emphasizing the beauty and splendor of Kṛṣṇaloka.

title: Verse Five
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The fifth verse describes Kṛṣṇa's eternal nature, His existence beyond the limitations of time and space, and His accessibility through pure devotion.

title: Verse Six
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The sixth verse repeats the first verse, emphasizing the beauty and splendor of Kṛṣṇaloka.

title: Verse Seven
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The seventh verse describes the difficulty of reaching Kṛṣṇaloka through ordinary means, but emphasizes that it is attainable through pure devotion.

title: Verse Eight
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The eighth verse repeats the first verse, emphasizing the beauty and splendor of Kṛṣṇaloka.

title: Verse Nine
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The ninth verse describes Kṛṣṇa's all-pervading nature, His presence in every atom of the universe.

title: Verse Ten
image_desc: - A photo of Lord Krishna with a beautiful garland of flowers.
narration: The tenth verse repeats the first verse, emphasizing the beauty and splendor of Kṛṣṇaloka.

title: Conclusion
content: - The Cintāmaṇi prayers are a beautiful expression of devotion to Kṛṣṇa.
- They inspire us to strive for a life of love and service to the Lord.
image_desc: - A photo of a beautiful, colorful, and ornate temple.
narration: The Cintāmaṇi prayers are a beautiful expression of devotion to Kṛṣṇa. They inspire us to strive for a life of love and service to the Lord.

title: Thank You
image_desc: - A photo of Srila Prabhupada smiling.
